abstract: Widely used anemia drugs sold by Amgen and Johnson & Johnson raise the risk of death among cancer patients by about 10 percent, a newly published analysis says.
snippet: Widely used anemia drugs sold by Amgen and Johnson & Johnson raise the risk of death among cancer patients by about 10 percent, a newly published analysis says.
lead_paragraph: Widely used anemia drugs sold by Amgen and Johnson & Johnson raise the risk of death among cancer patients by about 10 percent, according to a new analysis of previous clinical trials that is to be published Wednesday.

headline.main: Study Finds Death Risk From Anemia Drugs
headline.print_headline: Study Finds Increased Death Risk From Anemia Drugs
